arts.ttl: Mallorca protest against an "intolerable" housing situation
arts.sum: Thirty-seven organisations from the Balearics will take part in Saturday's protest against the housing situation on the islands. 'Mallorca Not For Sale' was started by the Banc de Temps collective in Sencelles, who were the principal organisers of the protest against the housing situation in May last year.

arts.ttl: Doggy bags for Mallorca bars and restaurants
arts.sum: The new law promotes the donation of surplus food in the distribution sector, obliges establishments over 1,300 square metres to have a plan for the prevention of food loss and waste and to promote agreements or arrangements to donate their surplus food to social initiative entities and other non-profit organisations or food banks. The law also includes specific measures for companies and social initiative entities and other non-profit organisations dedicated to the distribution of food for the donation of food suitable for human consumption.

arts.ttl: Mallorca's beach bars having problems recruiting staff
arts.sum: The possible staff shortages don't end at Easter, the beach bars being faced by precisely the same issues as the rest of the hospitality industry in Mallorca . Balneario, chiringuito.

Mallorca fell to a 1-0 loss to Valencia last weekend, a result that ended six-game unbeaten run. Conversely, though, Mallorca have now won only two of their last 10 league matches following the defeat...

arts.ttl: Can Mallorca make it into Europe?
arts.sum: – Real Mallorca face a final sprint of nine games (four at home, five away) in their quest to get a place in next season’s Conference League, starting with Galician side Celta Vigo in Son Moix tomorrow (Saturday, April 5) at 6.30pm . After a poor away display at Valencia last Sunday, coach Jagoba Arrasate was talking about the importance of tomorrow’s game as Celta also hope to take these giant steps to a European campaign next season.
Real Madrid and Barcelona have pulled away from the chasing pack as we head into gameweek 30 and Alex Wrigley has predictions for all 10 games in LaLiga.
